companyDescription:
As one of Canada’s largest, most established defence and security technology companies, General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is a dynamic force in the business community, tapping into the skills and resources of Canadian suppliers, building Canada’s manufacturing base, working with small businesses and Aboriginal companies, and supporting research and development; while providing an innovation-driven workplace for approximately 1,100 employees across Canada.

We provide advanced thinking, design expertise, and implementation know-how to equip military and first responders with leading-edge hardware, software and systems. 

Our business groups include: Land Communications, Airborne Mission Systems, Underwater Warfare and Public Safety & Security Solutions.
description:
Company Description
  At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, our focus extends beyond engineering technology solutions—we are dedicated to cultivating careers. Our mission is to establish a workplace that thrives on diversity, where your beliefs, cultural background, experiences, and ideas are valued and contribute to our collective strength. If you seek a purpose-driven career solving some of the world’s most critical problems, alongside some of the brightest engineering minds, your application is welcome. Join a community where your unique perspective propels innovation.
  Job Description
  As a Computer Graphics Specialist in our international Strategic Communications and Marketing team, you will play a key role in supporting the design of visually stunning and immersive graphics for a variety of digital applications. As an emerging talent with a fresh perspective, you will learn from and collaborate with our multidisciplinary team of engineers, designers, and marketers to bring ideas to life through innovative and high-quality graphics and videos.
  Graphic Design
  This is what most of your days will look like. Spoiler alert: no two days will be the same in our dynamic team.
 
   Design and prepare a wide variety of digital, and on occasion, print media (text, graphics, sound and animation) – which may include traditional applications and products – in support of Company activities
   Create 2D and 3D assets, including illustrations and renders, animations, videos and others, using industry standard 3D graphics and video/audio editing tools for electronic distribution (e.g. webpages)
   Develop interactive applications for touchscreens, leveraging industry-standard website software
   Test new imaging/graphics software to determine suitability
 
  On occasion, you may be asked to:
 
   Coordinate outside suppliers including 3D model file sourcing, in-house graphics, printing, photography, and videography, visual and trade show projects
   Design graphics and assembles trade show exhibits; prepare equipment mock-ups for shows
   Retouch or enhance photos and may use recording equipment to take photos/videos as required
   Prepare electronic images, designs and page layouts; integrate output to produce desired results.
   May produce and print artwork for product ID plates, and act as a backup for final production of ID plates
 
  Collaboration and Development
 
   Identify customer requirements and apply the most appropriate cost effective and viable processes/solutions to prepare storyboards and final assets
   Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand project goals, and contribute to creative discussions
   Research new technology and best practices
   Assist Team Lead with preparation of project estimates; guides and assists junior team members; and performs other related duties as required
   Learn from others and experiment with emerging technology
 
  Quality Assurance
 
   Follow company graphic standards/brand guidelines, ensuring quality and consistency of graphics across different platforms. Conduct testing and optimization to ensure graphic performance.
   Apply the appropriate specification and standards to illustrations and graphic designs.
 
  
  Qualifications
  Education/Experience
 
   Bachelor's degree or college diploma in graphic design, illustration, computer science, or other related discipline
   Approximately 6 years of relevant experience or equivalent level of combined education and experience
   Familiarity with HTML 5
 
  Additional Qualifications
 
   Proven experience in computer graphics, 2D/3D design, and video
   Proficiency in industry-standard design and video editing tools (e.g. Adobe Creative Suite, Blender, Maya, Unity)
   Practice in website design using editing tools (e.g. Webflow, Squarespace, Wordpress)
   Fundamental skills in photography and videography
   Strong portfolio showcasing a range of graphic design and animation projects
   Excellent collaboration and communication skills
   Able to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
 
  Must be able to obtain and maintain Canadian Security Clearance and a positive Controlled Goods Assessment. Eligibility to work in Canada either as a Canadian Citizen or Permanent Resident
  Additional Information
  Our success is fueled by individual diversity, encouraging applications from women, members of the LGBTQ2+ community, multi-cultural backgrounds, and persons with disabilities. We will work with you around any workplace accommodation required during our application process. If you require accommodation or have questions, please contact Human Resources via recruitment@gd-ms.ca.
  Our comprehensive benefits package is just another reason our employees stick around, enjoy:
 
   A Flexible Working Environment: Embracing a Hybrid work model with the choice of enjoying every other Friday off is more than a perk; it's a commitment to fostering a healthy work-life balance.
   Personalized Career Development: Your growth within the organization is not just supported; it's valued. Anticipate regular progress reviews, access to an Educational Assistance Program, and a personalized development plan tailored to your aspirations.
   Total Rewards Package: Consider it covered—health, dental, and beyond. Early access to a pension plan, coupled with various perks to acknowledge your contributions to the organization.
 
  Apply now to be a part of a workplace defined by who we are, and who we do it for.
